thread.title: Ecuador volcano spews giant ash column
thread.title_full: Ecuador volcano spews giant ash column | News24

author: news24.com
title: Ecuador volcano spews giant ash column
text:
Quito - Ecuador's Cotopaxi volcano, which began erupting in August after being dormant for 138 years, on Thursday coughed up a two-kilometre-high column of ash, officials said.
The giant ash column was visible from Quito, 45km to the north of the volcano, considered one of the world's most dangerous because its snow cap is vulnerable in an eruption and because of its close proximity to densely populated areas.
Ecuador's security coordination ministry said ash rose 2 000m above the volcano's crater, and warned some could fall on Quito's southern neighbourhoods.
Cotopaxi, one of eight active volcanoes in Ecuador, last erupted in 1877.
